sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Five officers from France's elite tactical police unit have been arrested in connection with the death of a 27-year-old man during July's riots in Marseille.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Wildfires in Portugal and Spain are burning hundreds of hectares of land as heat waves continue to fuel the fires.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Five officers from France's elite tactical police unit Raid were taken into custody on Tuesday in connection with the death of a 27-year-old man.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Mohamed Bendris, who worked for a delivery service, died in hospital in early July at the time of violent riots in the southern city of Marseille. He'd reportedly felt unwell while riding his scooter, but an autopsy showed traces of an impact on his chest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's believed this could have been caused by a rubber bullet, possibly fired by the police as they struggled to control violent riots in the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The protests were sparked by the death of a teenage boy who was shot dead by a policeman during a traffic check outside Paris in late June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The five officers were detained for questioning in the probe over Bendres' death and two of them were later released.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the Odeimeira region of Portugal's south-west, close to 1,000 firefighters are battling a wildfire, local authorities say. At least nine have been injured so far tackling the flames. About 7,000 hectares have burned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As a precautionary measure, more than 1,400 people had to be evacuated from villages and a campsite on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The fire broke out on Saturday as the country was hit by soaring temperatures and high winds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In Santarém, about 80 kilometres north-east of Lisbon, the mercury reached a record 46.4 degrees Celsius on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Neighboring Spain is experiencing its third heat wave this summer and is also battling a number of wildfires.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: One of the regions currently affected is Extremadura.

sentences.sentence: In Valencia de Alcántara, aquí estamos preocupados y con la angustia porque tenemos una masa forestal enorme, unos alcornoques centenarios y nos da mucha pena.

sentences.sentence: Los animales, tenemos vacas y eso preocupa por ellos. Estamos intentando reunirlas en sitios donde no arde para estar más tranquilos del incendio. Spain's AIMED weather agency said temperatures will continue to rise until at least Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Life is returning to normal in Niger's capital Niamey, two days after the end of an ultimatum from West African regional group ECOWAS to restore the democratically elected government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But politically things remain uncertain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The coup leaders have named a new prime minister, but the international community isn't ready to move on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On Tuesday, Brussels stressed that it won't work with what it calls the illegitimate authorities in Niger and is still pushing for diplomacy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: One thing is certain, there will be no positive consequences if this military coup is allowed to proceed and be established as a fact on the ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We still believe that there is a space, there is a room for mediation efforts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: ECOWAS is the main actor, the main regional actor in this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Whatever ECOWAS decides will then be implemented.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: in this, whatever ECOWAS decides will then be implemented. But leaders of the Junta in Niger have refused to receive a negotiating mission from the United Nations, ECOWAS and the African Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Citing security concerns, ECOWAS is due to meet on Thursday to discuss next steps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Italy has introduced a one-off 40% windfall tax targeting banks' extra profits from higher interest rates, a move that sent European market shares tumbling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Banks need to pay the levy if their 2022 net interest income exceeds the value of the year before by at least 3%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: If activated, it could add 2 to 3 billion euros to government coffers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Maloney called for the windfall tax to help ease the pressure on households.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: She says a series of interest rate hikes from the European Central Bank has seen banks reap the benefit while consumers pay the price.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In a post on social media, Maloney praised Parliament for voting in favour of the motion, saying Italy has been waiting 50 years for such a measure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, European shares dropped on Tuesday morning as the market considered Italy's new tax.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The reaction led to Italian banks taking a considerable hit too, with UniCredit, Intensa Sao Paolo and Monte dei Paschi, the Siena stocks, dipping.
